intro: Coelachne occidentalis, commonly known as the western coelachne, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and small, wind-pollinated flowers. Coelachne occidentalis is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential for use in horticulture.
